But...that was May, and many businesses have been forced to close again in recent weeks.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">World: </strong></span><span>The U.S. has formally </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-administration-gives-formal-notice-withdrawal-who-n1233100?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begun the process</a></span><span> of withdrawing from the World Health Organization, a move first announced back in May. The Trump administration has criticized the WHO’s response to the pandemic, saying the body is too heavily influenced by China. Both Republicans and Democrats knocked the decision for abdicating the U.S.' leadership on the world stage. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/08/apptopia-foursquare-report-shows-dramatic-shifts-us-transportation-due-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Transportation’s Long, Strange Trip
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Transportation GIF " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/SwDDHIfQpx0YQRWG2L/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Transportation GIF " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/SwDDHIfQpx0YQRWG2L/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If diseases have to-do lists, COVID-19 can check off “shake up U.S. transportation.” In a <a href="https://apptopia.com/mobility-report-us-transportation-trends?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> shared exclusively with Morning Brew, app tracker Apptopia and location data platform Foursquare show that the pandemic has rerouted how we get around. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s up:<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>New wheels, of the four and two variety</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More Americans are turning to the tried-and-true automobile as a transportation option that minimizes personal contact; visits to auto dealerships have already returned to pre-pandemic levels. Plus, new user growth in auto shopping apps has increased year over year in every month of the pandemic except April. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gas station visits are up too, and are even outpacing pre-pandemic levels in the Midwest (probably because gas is so cheap). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Similarly, people are flocking to bikes. Apptopia’s “bikeshare index” of bike-sharing apps such as Bay Wheels and Blue Bikes has catapulted beyond last year’s heights. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s down: scooters and public transportation</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Downloads of the top public transit apps lag last year’s numbers by 50%. Foot traffic to metro stations is down 68% since mid-February, while train station visits have sunk 60%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s not too surprising—getting on a crowded subway car is as unthinkable as a game of Twister right now. But the decline in scooter usage is more puzzling. Scoot-share apps Bird and Lime usually take a bit to recover from the winter months, but their daily active user numbers are still nowhere near last year’s ceiling. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s downish: </strong>ridesharing. Although demand for Uber and Lyft is on the rebound, those apps’ combined downloads are still 21% below last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re on the travel train: </strong>United <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-07/united-air-tumbles-with-viral-surge-endangering-bookings-rebound?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly warned</a> employees on Monday that the resurgence of coronavirus infections in the West and South sharply knocked bookings. United was the second-worst performer in the S&P yesterday, falling 7.6%. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/07/coronavirus-roundup-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
COVID-19 Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="DTC panel newsletter crop" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83ODgvZ2xvYmVfd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brazil: </strong>President Jair Bolsonaro said he <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/07/brazil-president-jair-bolsonaro-tests-positive-for-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for the coronavirus, a crisis he’s minimized for months even as Brazil suffers one of the world’s worst outbreaks. More than 65,000 people have died of the virus in Brazil. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Israel: </strong>The country’s top public health official <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jul/07/israeli-public-health-chief-quits-amid-rise-in-coronavirus-cases?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quit</a> yesterday over the government’s handling of a new spike in cases. Israel has once again closed businesses like bars and gyms due to the outbreak, which PM Benjamin Netanyahu said is spreading “as clear as the sun.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Australia: </strong>Authorities are reimplementing a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/07/asia/melbourne-coronavirus-lockdown-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lockdown</a> on Melbourne, the second-largest city, following a record high in daily COVID-19 cases. The measures go into effect tonight and will last six weeks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sweden: </strong>The country did not shut down its private sector as the coronavirus spread, but it’s still suffering <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/07/business/sweden-economy-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">considerable economic damage</a>, writes the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Southeast Asia: </strong><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-laos/health-officials-praise-laos-after-coronavirus-free-declaration-idUSKBN23P1XU?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Laos</a>, <a href="https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/luck-culture-helped-cambodia-contain-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cambodia</a>, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-vietnam/vietnam-reports-14-new-covid-19-cases-all-imported-idUSKBN2471C0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vietnam</a>, and <a href="https://www.bangkokpost.com/thailand/general/1947260/no-new-covid-cases-in-thailand-tuesday?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Thailand</a> remain remarkable success stories in controlling the virus. Of the four, only Thailand has any reported deaths (58). </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/07/walmart-reportedly-nearing-launch-amazon-prime-competitor?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Walmart Almost Ready to Greet New Subscription Service
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Walmart computer loading" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fSSAyTawZcQ8eYjIBk/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Walmart computer loading" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fSSAyTawZcQ8eYjIBk/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Walmart will <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/7/7/21314767/walmart-plus-grocery-delivery-amazon-prime-membership-loyalty-program-walmart?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roll out</a> its new subscription service later this month, Recode reported yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The name: </strong>Walmart+. The service will reportedly cost $98 a year and include same-day delivery, reserved delivery slots, and notifications when those slots are available, among other perks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The game: </strong>Make Amazon Prime work for it. Amazon’s subscription service has given it a giraffe leg up over Walmart in e-commerce...for too long, if you ask Walmart. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than half of Walmart’s top-spending families reportedly have Amazon Prime memberships. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Walmart’s advantage is its grocery business, which is currently larger than Amazon’s. But Walmart worries that if it doesn’t add its own subscription service, Prime’s perks could seduce its customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The pain: </strong>Walmart originally planned to launch the service in March or April, per Recode’s reporting, but COVID-19 forced it to push those plans back.</p>

</table>
<img alt="TikTok " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDczL3Rpa3Rvay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For decades, China protected its tech industry like a mother bear. But now that its platforms are developing global ambitions, they’re having to deal with blowback from the government’s controversial actions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just look at TikTok, which recently found itself ensnared in four geopolitical dramas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Drama #1: </strong>On Monday, Sec. of State Mike Pompeo <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/07/tech/us-tiktok-ban/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the U.S. is “looking at” banning the video app. TikTok has tried distancing itself from Chinese parent company ByteDance⁠ by hiring an American CEO, moving data centers outside China, and pledging not to hand over user data⁠—but some officials still worry Beijing is using it to spy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bad news for TikTok is good news for U.S. platforms: Snap stock </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/07/snap-soars-as-pompeo-talks-about-tiktok-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a></span><span> over 8% following Pompeo’s comments.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Drama #2:</strong> ByteDance <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tiktok-to-pull-out-of-hong-kong-after-china-imposed-national-security-law-11594096439?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it will pull TikTok</a> in Hong Kong, following similar moves of protest from Facebook, Twitter, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Zoom over a new Chinese national security law that critics say violates Hong Kong’s autonomy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Drama #3: </strong>Last week, India <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/07/01/india-bans-59-apps-including-tiktok-citing-national-security-privacy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned TikTok</a> and 58 other Chinese apps over an escalating border dispute with China. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And finally, drama #4: </strong><a href="https://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/celebrity-couples/a33233994/charli-damelio-called-out-chase-hudson-cheating-denial/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chase “Lil Huddy” Hudson</a> reportedly cheated on TikTok darling Charli D’Amelio earlier this year.</p>

PROFILE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/07/amancio-ortegas-investment-firm-reveals-vast-real-estate-holdings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<img alt="Spanish retail tycoon Amancio Ortega " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjQ5L2FtYW5jaW9fb3J0ZWdhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Name: </strong>Amancio Ortega</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Claim to fame: </strong>Ortega is the cofounder of Inditex, the world’s largest fashion group and owner of the Zara fashion chain. With a net worth of $63.6 billion, he’s Spain’s richest person. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why he’s the mogul for the moment: </strong>Yesterday, his holding company Pontegadea revealed it’s got an outrageously huge real estate portfolio worth $17.2 billion at the end of 2019. Its properties <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-pontegadea-results/zara-founder-books-15-billion-euros-real-estate-assets-in-2019-idUSKBN2480S6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">include</a> the E.V. Haughwout Building in NYC’s SoHo neighborhood, office buildings in London, Miami, and Seattle, and a hotel in downtown Chicago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the pandemic tests even the moguliest of moguls. Ortega’s toes are dipped in two industries—commercial real estate and retail—that are getting especially crushed by the coronavirus. The commercial real estate market has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-triggers-steep-drop-in-new-york-city-commercial-property-sales-11594047809?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collapsed</a> in cities like NYC, while Inditex suffered its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/10/inditex-q1-2020-earnings-material-impact-from-covid-19.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first-ever</a> quarterly loss in Q1. </p>

But...that was May, and many businesses have been forced to close again in recent weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWorld: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. has formally \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-administration-gives-formal-notice-withdrawal-who-n1233100?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegun the process\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of withdrawing from the World Health Organization, a move first announced back in May. The Trump administration has criticized the WHO’s response to the pandemic, saying the body is too heavily influenced by China. Both Republicans and Democrats knocked the decision for abdicating the U.S.' leadership on the world stage. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRANSPORTATION \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/08/apptopia-foursquare-report-shows-dramatic-shifts-us-transportation-due-covid19?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nU.S. Transportation’s Long, Strange Trip\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Transportation GIF \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/SwDDHIfQpx0YQRWG2L/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Transportation GIF \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/SwDDHIfQpx0YQRWG2L/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf diseases have to-do lists, COVID-19 can check off “shake up U.S. transportation.” In a \u003ca href=\"https://apptopia.com/mobility-report-us-transportation-trends?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e shared exclusively with Morning Brew, app tracker Apptopia and location data platform Foursquare show that the pandemic has rerouted how we get around. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s up:\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eNew wheels, of the four and two variety\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore Americans are turning to the tried-and-true automobile as a transportation option that minimizes personal contact; visits to auto dealerships have already returned to pre-pandemic levels. Plus, new user growth in auto shopping apps has increased year over year in every month of the pandemic except April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGas station visits are up too, and are even outpacing pre-pandemic levels in the Midwest (probably because gas is so cheap). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSimilarly, people are flocking to bikes. Apptopia’s “bikeshare index” of bike-sharing apps such as Bay Wheels and Blue Bikes has catapulted beyond last year’s heights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s down: scooters and public transportation\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDownloads of the top public transit apps lag last year’s numbers by 50%. Foot traffic to metro stations is down 68% since mid-February, while train station visits have sunk 60%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s not too surprising—getting on a crowded subway car is as unthinkable as a game of Twister right now. But the decline in scooter usage is more puzzling. Scoot-share apps Bird and Lime usually take a bit to recover from the winter months, but their daily active user numbers are still nowhere near last year’s ceiling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s downish: \u003c/strong\u003eridesharing. Although demand for Uber and Lyft is on the rebound, those apps’ combined downloads are still 21% below last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re on the travel train: \u003c/strong\u003eUnited \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-07/united-air-tumbles-with-viral-surge-endangering-bookings-rebound?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereportedly warned\u003c/a\u003e employees on Monday that the resurgence of coronavirus infections in the West and South sharply knocked bookings. United was the second-worst performer in the S\u0026P yesterday, falling 7.6%. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Israel has once again closed businesses like bars and gyms due to the outbreak, which PM Benjamin Netanyahu said is spreading “as clear as the sun.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAustralia: \u003c/strong\u003eAuthorities are reimplementing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/07/asia/melbourne-coronavirus-lockdown-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elockdown\u003c/a\u003e on Melbourne, the second-largest city, following a record high in daily COVID-19 cases. The measures go into effect tonight and will last six weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSweden:
